revised_title: Cheirostrobus: A New Type of Fossil Cone from Lower Carboniferous Strata
tldr: The author examines a new type of fossil cone, Cheirostrobus, found in the lower Carboniferous strata (Calciferous Sandstone Series). The cone's structure and affinities suggest it is closely related to the Sphenophyllaceous plants, a group of plants with undetermined affinities. The discovery of Cheirostrobus in such an ancient deposit highlights the possibility of finding synthetic types of plants with combined characteristics of distinct orders.
